You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the tower's existence for another 24 hours. You can create a permanent tower by casting this spell in the same location and with the same configuration every day for one year.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the tower can have one additional story for each slot level beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: This spell functions like the {@spell greater invisibility} spell, except that it masks both image, smell, and sound.
As with greater invisibility, this spell doesn't end if you attack or cast a spell.

While invisible, any sound or smell you give off is nullified (centered on you) in a 5-foot radius, preventing detection by tremorsense and similar abilities (though you can still detect scents and hear as normal).

Superior invisibility makes you immune to detection by the {@spell see invisibility} and {@spell faerie fire} spells as well as the tremorsense ability, though you can be detected by true seeing or the blindsight ability.
Certain conditions (such as leaving footprints) can also make you detectable.

spell.name: Mercer's Mourning

m.text: A feather of a grey owl that is waved in the air

entries: One creature of your choice that you can see within range is overcome with grief and falls into a weeping fit if this spell affects it. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall prone, becoming incapacitated and unable to stand up for the duration. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isn’t affected.
At the end of each of its turns, and each time it takes damage, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Rhoderihck's Web of Fire

m.text: a cat's cradle of thread or string coated in phosphorus

entries: Striking both palms down upon the ground, a web of flame crackles out around you and five streaks of fire rapidly snake along the ground toward up to five enemies that you can see within range, leaping towards their target and exploding into a column of flame upon reaching them. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Alternatively, all five streaks of fire can instead converge toward a single target, dealing {@dice 12d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire can travel over obstacles up to 5 feet high, and ignites flammable objects along its path that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledice 8d6|4-9|1d6} (8d6) or {@scaledice 12d6|4-9|1d6} (12d6) for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Aganazzar's Hurlgate

m.text: a lodestone, iron filings and a red dragon's scale

entries: This spell temporarily malforms gravity in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area are jettisoned upward into the center of the sphere. When a creature or object reaches the center of the sphere, they are teleported to a point in the air you choose within range. After they are teleported, all creatures and objects are slammed downwards into the ground, adding {@dice 1d6} for every 10 feet fallen. A creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, thus avoiding the pull. Otherwise, any creature that hits the ground in this way takes {@dice 5d10} force damage.

spell.name: Robin's Resonant Echo
entries: You tap into unused branching timelines to create an echo copy of yourself that has the ability to cast one spell that you have prepared before vanishing. The spell level of the spell cast by the echo must be lower than the level of the spell slot used to cast the echo. If the echo casts a spell that requires concentration, you maintain concentration on that spell when the echo disappears. If you were already concentrating on a spell, choose which spell you will maintain concentration on, and which spell will dissapate.

The echo has hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the echo up to 30 feet in any direction. The echo cannot go through enemies nor can it pass through walls.

Also, whenever you are hit by a ranged or melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to swap places with the echo, allowing it to take the damage instead of you. You must be withing 30 feet of the echo to be able to do this. After you do this however, the echo immediately dissapates.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, another echo is created for each slot above 4th. However, any duplicate other than the first cannot cast spells. You can however, when using the bonus action to move the duplicates, move all of the duplicates at once, each in a separate direction.

spell.name: Know Time
entries: By casting this spell, you immediately learn the precise time of day to the nearest minute, including the current hour, day, month, and year.

spell.name: Ana's Aiding Aura
entries: Healing power radiates from you in an aura with a 5-foot radius, soothing pain in friendly creatures. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. While in the aura, all allies in the aura (including you) heal {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting modifier whenever they start their turn in the aura or move through it's space on their turn.

spell.name: Muffle

m.text: a small piece of leather from an old boot

entries: A creature you touch becomes {@condition muffled|Nymm} until the spell ends, concealing all sound made by them. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is muffled as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Invisibility Sphere

m.text: a small transparent piece of crystal

entries: Whenever you cast this spell, you and each willing creature turns invisible within 10 feet of you. Any creature affected by this spell can see others affected by the spell as if they were unaffected. If a creature makes an attack or casts a spell within the sphere, it loses it's invisibility, but only for itself. The spell ends whenever you make an attack roll or cast another spell.

spell.name: Greater Fly

components.m: a wing feather from any large bird

entries: You choose up to three willing creatures within range. The targets gain a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Lily's Vault of Amber
entries: You arrange 5 small amber gems in a loose circle around any non-living materials and trace Transmutative sigils above each of them. All materials within the circle are pulled into the largest of the gems and stored there, in stasis. The contents do not age, weather, or rot. The gem can hold up to 50olbs of material.
After you've cast this spell, you can use an action to speak a single, chosen word and release the gem’s contents onto the ground. Contents are also released if dispelled.

legendaryGroup.name: Hephaestus
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Hephaestus takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Hephaestus can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Part of the ceiling collapses above one creature that Hephaestus can see within 120 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@dice 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone and buried. The buried target is restrained and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature can take an action to make a DC 10 Strength check, ending the buried state on a success.

regionalEffects: The region containing Hephaestuses lair is warped by his magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Dark Clouds swirl and make a strange, vortex-like effect above his Castle.
Orcs and Drow scour this area, as well as the occasional blinded Goblin. The Goblins have blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.
The land within 6 miles of the lair is shrouded by grey clouds, making everything dim-lit.

regionalEffects: If Hephaestus dies, The Drow, Goblins and Orcs scatter into the Shadowfell, and the other effects, such as the Dark Clouds and Dim-lit ground slowly disperse over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Saundor
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Saundor takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Saundor can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Any creature within 10 feet of the wall becomes grappled (save DC 16), as vines wrap around it.
three random 10-foot squares turn into difficult terrain.

regionalEffects: The region containing Saundor's lair is warped by his cancerous influence, which creates one or more of the following effects:
If Saundor Dies, he will slowly reform under the Labenda tree, over the course of {@dice 1d10} days. During those days, the swamp becomes less noticably dark, as light can shine through once more.

legendaryGroup.name: Vess
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Lady Vess takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; Lady Vess can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: Any creature within 10 feet of the wall becomes grappled (save DC 16), as vines wrap around it.
three random 10-foot squares turn into difficult terrain, and any creature that starts it's turn there must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, or take {@dice 3d6} piercing damage.

random 5-foot squares turn into roses, turning into difficult terrain, and deal {@dice 1d10} piercing damage plus {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage whenever a creature walks into the roses on their turn or start their turn there.

regionalEffects: The region containing Saundor's lair is warped by his cancerous influence, which creates one or more of the following effects:
If Saundor Dies, he will slowly reform under the Labenda tree, over the course of {@dice 1d10} days. During those days, the swamp becomes less noticably dark, as light can shine through once more.

optionalfeature.name: Aether Bomb
entries: When you throw one of your explosives, you can choose to have it deal necrotic damage on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Additional Master Mutagen
entries: You can prepare an additional Master Mutagen for the cost of two normal mutagens.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Arcane Studies
entries: You may cast the spells you chose from your Extra Arcane Studies discovery more frequently. These spells are now restored after completing a short or long rest.
This discovery is permanent. Additionally, your Extra Arcane Studies discovery becomes permanent when you learn this discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Adept Esoteric Studies

otherSummary.entry: Esoteric Studies, School of The Great Work
otherSummary.entrySummary: Esoteric Studies, School of The Great Work

entries: You may cast the spells you chose from your Esoteric Studies discovery more frequently. These spells are now restored after completing a short or long rest.
This discovery is permanent. Additionally, your Extra Arcane Studies discovery becomes permanent when you learn this discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Makeup
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Persuasion} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemic Mine
entries: You can prepare one special explosive in place of an explosive you could normally prepare to explode when a creature approaches. You can set this explosive against a flat surface as an action. A creature can make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check against your spell save DC to notice the mine. If you spend one round burying the mine under a small layer of dirt or similarly light cover, the creature has disadvantage on the check. When a small or larger creature unaware of the mine's presence enters the mine's space, they set it off unless they are flying or otherwise aloft. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take damage equal to one of your explosives or half as much on a successful save. (This particular kind of explosive does not have splash damage) A creature aware of the mine can choose to move half its speed on its turn to move through the mine's space without setting it off.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy Practice
entries: You gain proficiency in either a {@item Herbalism Kit|phb} or a {@item Poisoner’s Kit|phb}. Alternatively, you can choose to double your proficiency in {@item Alchemy Supplies|phb}, {@item Herbalism Kits|phb}, or {@item Poisoner’s Kits|phb} that you're proficient with (Alchemists of the School of the Venomist immediately doubles their proficiency with Poisoner's Kits in addition to another affect of this discovery).

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Studies
entries: You learn {@filter three cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. This discovery is permanent. An alchemist of the School of the Great Work learns an additional cantrip from the druid spell list when they learn this discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Assassin's Blade
entries: Any weapon attack you make that doesn't already apply poison damage deals an extra {@dice 1d4} poison damage. (Alchemists of the School of the Venomist deals {@dice 1d6} extra damage when they use this discovery).

optionalfeature.name: Augmented Anatomy
entries: One ability score of your choice increases by 4 and the maximum of that score increases to 24. This discovery is permanent. This ability score increase need not be the one you chose for your Enhanced Anatomy discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Axiomatic Bomb
entries: Your bombs are now capable of dealing radiant damage when you use your {@i Elemental Affinity} feature. All creatures affected by this explosive must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become blinded for one minute and deafened until the start of your next turn. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the start of subsequent turns, ending these effects early on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Transformation
entries: You have learned how to change in a more bestial way. You can prepare this mutagen in the place of another you could prepare. When you drink this mutagen, you take on the effects of the polymorph spell, targeting only yourself. Your mental ability scores stay the same (though you cannot speak in this form) and your hit points equal your Alchemist level unless the beast’s are higher.

optionalfeature.name: Breaching Charge
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to blow through solid objects. The damage type of these bombs changes to thunder, and they deal double damage to solid objects and siege engines not being worn or carried. (If you have the Delayed Bomb discovery, you can stick these explosives to solid objects before using your action—or possible bonus action—to detonate them.)

optionalfeature.name: Brewmaster
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Brewer's Supplies|phb}. (Alchemists of the School of The Brewer receive expertise in {@item Brewer's Supplies|phb}.)

optionalfeature.name: Caustic Blood
entries: Whenever a creature within 5ft. of you hits you with an attack, that creature takes acid damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). (Alchemists of the School of the Mutator deals damage equal to half their Alchemist level or their Constitution modifier—whichever is higher—when using this discovery).

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Poison
entries: Your toxins now affect undead.

optionalfeature.name: Chameleon
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill. Additionally, you double your proficiency bonus with this skill.

optionalfeature.name: Choking Gas
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to produce a thick plume of greenish, toxic smoke. Instead of dealing instant damage, the explosive fills a 15ft. sphere with smoke, heavily obscuring the area for one minute. A creature that enters the smoke or starts its turn in the smoke takes poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. A creature that doesn’t need to breathe is unaffected. A wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses the smoke in one round.

optionalfeature.name: Cluster Bomb
entries: You can throw two explosives at once as an action provided they are the same damage type. Additionally, you can throw an explosive using a bonus action and still use other explosives using your action on that turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cognatogen
entries: You’ve learned how to flip the basic mutagen benefits to allow for more versatility. You can prepare a special mutagen in place of a normal one. Upon drinking this mutagen, you gain a +1 bonus to all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws and gain advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability checks for 10 minutes. You also gain disadvantage on all Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability checks for the duration as well.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Prowess
entries: You’ve learned how to bolster your combat effectiveness with mutagens. You can prepare a special mutagen in place of a normal one, and for a number of minutes equal to your Intelligence modifier you can attack twice instead of once when you take the attack option on your turn. Additionally, if you are wearing light or no armor, your armor class becomes 10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your Intelligence modifier. While under the effects of this mutagen, you cannot drink any of your elixirs. Treat elixirs as a mutagen for purposes of drinking multiple mutagens.

optionalfeature.name: Concussion Grenade
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to deliver a disorienting assault. Instead of dealing damage, any creature within the explosion's splash damage radius must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier and be blinded until the start of your next turn. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the start of subsequent turns, ending these effects early on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Cosmic Shard
entries: Your Crystalized Aether feature replaces material components with a value of 25gp or less.

optionalfeature.name: Darkness Bomb
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to remove all light from an area. After you throw this bomb a 15ft. sphere of magical darkness springs forth for one minute. The darkness spreads around corners, and a creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. If any of this explosive’s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled. (If the Alchemist is at least 9th level and follows the School of The Grenadier, the level of the darkness effect equals the appropriate slot (if any) the explosive occupies assuming the slot is 3rd-level or higher. Otherwise it's cast at it's lowest level).

optionalfeature.name: Delayed Bomb
entries: You can delay the detonation of an explosive you’ve thrown within 30 ft. of you for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier. As an action, you can detonate this explosive, otherwise is explodes after all rounds are expended. (Alchemists of the School of the Grenadier can detonate their explosive as a bonus action.)

optionalfeature.name: Directed Bomb
entries: You can prepare any number of special explosive in place of any explosives you could normally prepare to explode in a 15ft. cone rather than a sphere. When you throw the explosive, you choose the direction of the cone.

optionalfeature.name: Dispelling Bomb
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosives in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to mimic the effects of the dispel magic spell within a 15ft. sphere as if cast at its lowest level. This explosive utilizes your spellcasting modifier. (If the alchemist is at least 9th level and follows the School of the Grenadier, the level of the dispel magic effect equals the appropriate slot (if any) the explosive occupies assuming the slot is 4th-level or higher. Otherwise it's cast at it's lowest level).

optionalfeature.name: Draught of Mutation
entries: You can prepare one mutagen upon completing a long rest (Alchemists of the School of the Mutator can prepare an additional mutagen whenever they prepare mutagens during a short or long rest).

optionalfeature.name: Duck and Cover
entries: You gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Transmutation
entries: You learn the {@spell fabricate} spell and can cast it as a wizard does without expending an elixir slot. You must complete a long rest before you can cast this spell again. (An alchemist of the School of the Great Work can cast this spell again after completing a short or long rest).

optionalfeature.name: Elixir Adept
entries: You can prepare an additional two 1st-level elixirs.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir of Recovery
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare one Elixir of Recovery. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare. If this item is poured on a corpse that has died within the past minute, it returns to life with 1 hit point. You can prepare one Elixir of Recovery after completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir of Unlife
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare an Elixir of Unlife. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare. This item is poured onto a corpse or pile of bones, granting the semblance of the animate undead spell targeting only one target. You can prepare one Elixir of Unlife after completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Anatomy
entries: One ability score of your choice increases by 2 to a maximum of 20.
You may select this discovery multiple times, each time choosing a different ability score. You cannot choose the same ability score more than once. This discovery is permanent.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Keen Sight
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet. Additionally, the distance your Keen Sight discovery covers is increased by 30 ft.
This discovery is permanent. Additionally, when you choose this discovery, your Keen Sight discovery becomes permanent as well.

optionalfeature.name: Esoteric Studies
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 60 feet. Additionally, the distance your Keen Sight discovery covers is increased by 30 ft.
This discovery is permanent. Additionally, when you choose this discovery, your Keen Sight discovery becomes permanent as well.

optionalfeature.name: Esoteric Studies
entries: Choose one 1st-level spell and one 2nd-level spell from the druid spell list. You can cast those spells in the way a druid does without expending an elixir slot. You must complete a long rest before you can cast either of these spells again.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Ammunition
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare and attach them to a form of ammunition. If the ammunition hits when fired, the bomb explodes as if you threw it. If the attack misses, the explosive does not go off. (If the ammunition is destroyed upon impact, the explosive is destroyed as well).

optionalfeature.name: Extra Arcane Studies
entries: Choose one 1st-level and one 2nd-level formulae that you know. You can cast those spells in the way a wizard does without expending an elixir slot. You must complete a long rest before you can cast either of these spells in this way again.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of Arcana
entries: You can sense the presence of magic within 30ft. of you. An Alchemist of the School of the Great Work can sense the presence of magic within 60ft. of themself at 10th level if they learn this discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of Detection
entries: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30ft. of you and within line of sight. A 17th level Alchemist of the School of the Mutator gains truesight out to a range of 30ft. when they choose this discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Tonic
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare an elixir of levitate. A creature that drinks this tonic can only target themself, otherwise this functions as a normal elixir. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare.

optionalfeature.name: Feral Mutation
entries: When you prepare your mutagens you can choose to prepare a special one in place of a normal one. When you drink this mutagen you grow wings, granting you a 30ft. flying speed while wearing light or no armor; and you grow sharp claws, fangs, or horns granting yourself natural weapons that deal {@dice 2d10} + your Strength modifier slashing or piercing damage. These weapons count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances and immunities to nonmagical weapons and use your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier for the attack rolls. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls. This mutagen lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Intelligence modifier. While under the effects of this mutagen if you use your action to perform anything other than the Attack action, you take {@dice 2d6} psychic damage. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. If you attempt to end your turn within 5ft. of a creature and still have your action, you must use it to attack that creature. If a creature provokes an attack of opportunity as a result of leaving your reach, you must attempt to attack that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Flashbang
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to deliver a burst of light. Instead of dealing damage, any creature within the explosion's splash damage radius must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier (to a minimum of 1) and {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the start of each of their turns, ending these effects on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Bomb
entries: You can prepare any number of special explosive in place of any explosives you could normally prepare to deliver a burst of force. Instead of dealing damage, any creature within the explosive's splash damage radius must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20ft. away from the center of the explosion and be knocked {@condition prone}, or be pushed half as much and stay standing on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Hasty Mixture
entries: You can prepare a number of explosives equal to half your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) during a short rest. These explosives aren’t as powerful and only deal {@dice 1d4} fire damage on a hit and half your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to all creatures affected by the explosive's splash damage. Alchemists of the School of the Grenadier do not receive this damage reduction upon reaching 9th level.

optionalfeature.name: Homing Grenade
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare with magic to track an enemy. This special grenade has been fitted with magics akin to the magic missile spell. When you throw this explosive at a creature in range, you strike the target for {@dice 2d4} force damage. All creatures within 5ft. of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take force damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Quaff
entries: You are not restricted to drinking one elixir per turn when using your Swift Quaff feature, but one of the elixirs cannot exceed 1st level.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Sight
entries: You gain darkvision out to a range of 60ft. If you already possess darkvision, increase the range you can see by 30ft. Alchemists of the School of Mutation, double the range of this discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Luminescence
entries: You can create two small, clear flasks of glowing liquid over the course of a short rest. This liquid sheds bright light out to a range of 15ft. and dim light 15ft. beyond that for 8 hours. A creature can also choose to fill a lamp or lantern with Luminescence, doubling the range of the bright and dim light produced by the lamp or lantern, but the Luminescence can only burn for 1 hour. You must complete a short or long rest before you can create any more Luminescence. An Alchemist of the School of The Great Work can burn Luminescence in a lamp or lantern for a number of hours equal to their Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Master Elixir
entries: You can prepare another 6th level elixir when you prepare your elixirs.

optionalfeature.name: Masterful Arcane Studies

otherSummary.entry: Arcane Studies, Adept Arcane Studies, School of The Brewer
otherSummary.entrySummary: Arcane Studies, Adept Arcane Studies, School of The Brewer

entries: You may cast the spells you chose from your Extra Arcane Studies at will without expending an elixir slot. This discovery is permanent.

optionalfeature.name: Net Bomb
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to entangle your enemies. These explosives do not deal damage, and anyone within the explosive's splash damage radius must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition restrained} for one minute. A creature can attempt to make a Strength saving throw at the beginning of each of their turns, freeing themselves on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Packed Explosives
entries: Your explosive deal additional damage to its struck target equal to your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, the explosive's splash damage increases to 10ft. This discovery does not apply to other discoveries that have an explicit explosive splash damage radius or the Explosive Ammunition discovery.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Elixir
entries: When preparing your elixirs, you can prepare a Phantom elixir. When you drink this elixir, you become incorporeal for one minute. While incorporeal, you can walk through walls and creatures as if they were difficult terrain. If this effect ends while you're inside a creature or object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take force damage equal to the number of feet you were pushed. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare. A 17th level alchemist of the School of the Brewer can prepare an additional Phantom Elixir in the place of one of their 6th or 7th level formula.

optionalfeature.name: Philosopher's Stone
entries: You can use your Philosopher's Liquid feature twice when you prepare your elixirs.

optionalfeature.name: Potions Expert
entries: You can identify the properties of any potion assuming you handle it for one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Powder Bomb
entries: You can prepare up to two special explosive in place of up to two explosives you could normally prepare to explode with a white dust. The explosive deals no damage, but dust fills a 30ft. sphere and reveals the location of any tangible invisible creatures in its area. Upon reaching 5th level, this discovery applies to invisible incorporeal creatures as well.

optionalfeature.name: Quicksilver Coating
entries: You can prepare two special coatings in the place of one of the elixirs of 1st level or higher you can normally prepare. When this liquid is applied to a melee weapon or twenty pieces of ammunition, the weapon becomes "silvered" for 8 hours. Upon reaching 5th level, you can prepare a number of coatings equal to your Intelligence modifier for every elixir it replaces.

optionalfeature.name: Reagent Research
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} skills. If you already have either proficiency, you gain expertise in those skills.

optionalfeature.name: Sluggish Toxin
entries: When a creature is affected by the poisoned condition from one of your toxins, they only add half their Dexterity modifier to their armor class—if applicable—and can only take one action or bonus action on their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Speedy Metabolism
entries: Whenever you would roll dice to heal yourself from a potion or elixir, you instead heal for the maximum amount.

optionalfeature.name: Strong Brew
entries: 1st-level elixirs you create that deal damage add your Intelligence modifier to the damage roll. Level 13 Alchemists of the School of the Brewer can apply this bonus to all elixir effects they create.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: You can prepare any number of special explosives in place of any explosives you could normally prepare to produce a thick plume of smoke. Instead of dealing damage, the explosive fills a 15ft. sphere with smoke, heavily obscuring the area for one minute. A wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses the smoke in one round.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Aptitude
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare an elixir of {@spell enhance ability} at its lowest level. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare. Alchemists of the School of The Mutator can replace one of their mutagens with this elixir upon reaching 15th level.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Energy
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare an elixir of {@spell haste} targeting whoever drank it. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Leaping
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare an elixir of {@spell jump}. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Nourishment
entries: You can prepare two special tonics in the place of one of the elixirs of 1st level or higher you can normally prepare. When a creature drinks this tonic, they receive the benefits of having eaten a berry from the {@spell goodberry} spell. Upon reaching 10th level, you can prepare a number of tonics equal to your Intelligence modifier for every elixir it replaces.

optionalfeature.name: Tonic of Warding
entries: When you prepare your elixirs, you can prepare an elixir of {@spell mage armor}. This elixir does not count against the number of elixirs you can prepare.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Death
entries: You can apply poisons and toxins you create to your hand without poisoning yourself. You can then make a melee spell attack or unarmed strike against a target. On a hit, the poison is applied to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Virulent Gas

otherSummary.entry: Choking Gas, School of The Venomist
otherSummary.entrySummary: Choking Gas, School of The Venomist

entries: Your choking gas now affects creatures whether they need to breathe or not. The gas deals an additional {@dice 3d8} acid damage as well.

optionalfeature.name: Volatile Toxins
entries: Toxins can benefit from both your Potent Toxins feature and deal damage as well.

items: A muffled creature is impossible to hear without the aid of magic or a special sense. For the purpose of hiding, any Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check made to hear them automatically fails. For creatures with only Tremorsense, this creature is completely invisible.
A creature under this condition also negates disadvantage while wearing armor that would normally give it disadvantage.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: Your choice of a {@filter gaming set|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=gaming set} or a {@filter musical instrument|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=instrument}

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: One set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, a signet, banner, or seal representing your place or rank in the order, and a {@item pouch|phb} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Lightbringer
entries: Having come from the Sun Soul Order, people see the warm light you shed as a beacon of peace. Thus, most people may give their aid to you in your time of need, regardless of the rarity or strangeness of your race.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Use the tables for the {@background soldier} background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a Sun Soul Member.
Your bond almost always involves The Order, and it is highly unusual for a member's ideal not to reflect the agenda, sentiment, or philosophy of The Order.

feat.name: Mystic Conflux
entries: Through your repeated exposure of the natural flow of arcane magic throughout Nymm, you've adapted to attune with additional enchantments, though the process can by physically taxing. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks when investigating the nature of a magical object or device.
You can now be attuned to a maximum of four magical items, rather than the normal limit of three. Other attunement limitations still apply.

feat.name: Rapid Drinker
entries: Through a lifestyle of hard, competitive drinking, you’ve learned how to quaff drinks at an incredibly accelerated pace. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can drink a potion as a Bonus action, instead of as an action.
You have advantage on any saving throws triggered by ingesting an alcoholic or dangerous substance.

feat.name: Spelldriver
entries: Through a lifestyle of hard, competitive drinking, you’ve learned how to quaff drinks at an incredibly accelerated pace. You gain the following benefits:

items: Through intense focus, training, and dedication, you’ve harnessed the techniques of rapid spellcasting. You are no longer limited to only one non-cantrip spell per turn. However, should you cast two or more spells in a single turn, only one of them can be of 3rd level or higher.
